ENSO Vertical Processes Diagnostic Package

This MDTF Process Oriented Diagnostics are designed to compliment and inform the mean and seasonal anomalies of diveregnce source terms in the Rossby Wave Source POD. It produces vertical profiles of the divergence and other column quantities essential to our understanding of vertical tendency processes in GCMs and how they relate to parameterized processes. There is range of diagnostics include reanalyses product comparisons, CMIP and AMIP ensembles, comparisons alondside model development versions and within a spread from a large ensemble set.

POD Documentation

Analysis regions:
  • TCP: Tropical Central Pacific 160E-140W; 10S-EQ (Main tropical forcing)
  • STP: Sub-tropical Pacific 150E-160W; 25-40N (RWS generation region)
  • TWP: Tropical West Pacific 110E-150E; EQ-15N (Additional contribution to RWS)


LEVEL 1: Reanalysis and Observations

ENSO SST Anomalies
TCP: Divergence Omega Zonal Wind Temperature Specific Humidity
STP: Divergence Omega Zonal Wind Temperature Specific Humidity
TWP: Divergence Omega Zonal Wind Temperature Specific Humidity

LEVEL 2: Development Version Ensembles

TCP: Divergence Moist Physics (dT/dt) Deep Convection (dT/dt) Microphysics (dT/dt)
STP: Divergence Moist Physics (dT/dt) Deep Convection (dT/dt) Microphysics (dT/dt)
TWP: Divergence Moist Physics (dT/dt) Deep Convection (dT/dt) Microphysics (dT/dt)

LEVEL 3: AMIP/CMIP Ensemble

LEVEL 4: Initial Value Ensembles

TCP: Divergence Moist Physics (dT/dt)
STP: Divergence Moist Physics (dT/dt)
TCP: Divergence Moist Physics (dT/dt)

LEVEL 5: Divergence Heating Relationships

-Scatter plots: Divergence, heating profile relationship (level 250-150mb)
